contents: (1) Between burning fossil fuels and clearing forests, humans emit far more carbon dioxide than Earth’s natural physical and biological processes can remove from the atmosphere. (2) Fundamental to any attempts to understand, slow, or reverse the buildup of atmospheric carbon dioxide is a global accounting of where it’s released and stored. (3) That’s why scientists at NOAA’s Earth Systems Research Laboratory created CarbonTracker: a carbon dioxide measuring and modeling system that tracks sources and sinks around the globe.
